website_summaries.verdict: Compact, rugged, fast and capacious, the Portable SSD T3 is an excellent portable storage device to take on the go.
pros: The Portable SSD T3 is super compact, rugged, fast and can have up to 2TB of storage space
The drive has a USB-C port, allowing it to work with more devices than other portable drives
cons: The T3 is a tad larger and slightly slower than its predecessor, the T1, while costing more
Its three-year warranty is short for a storage device at this price

customer_reviews.title: Great tiny portable SSD!
customer_reviews.text: Great speed and very easy usage. Reached 421MB read and 403MB write speed on a Thunderbolt III / USD 3.1 port. Pairs beautifully with a Asus Zenbook Pro laptop which has already an internal SSD. Great to have more disk space without losing much speed and without having to replace the internal SSD. Encryption feature is also a nice add-on.
customer_reviews.author: coolmig

customer_reviews.title: Fast SSD, small, light and portable. Issues ...
customer_reviews.text: Fast SSD, small, light and portable. Issues with useage on OSX sierra, required software and driver install for password encryption from Samsung. I prefer to just use OSX's whole drive encryption through disk utility. Swapping it to other Mac computers also requires software and driver installation, may cause issues such as not being able to format to a specific file system with encryption and drive not being able to see the partition.
customer_reviews.author: SkyZero

customer_reviews.title: Great for Mac boot drive.
customer_reviews.text: Added this as a boot drive to 2014 Mac mini. Installed El Capitan, migrated apps and settings and just put an alias link to my old documents folder in new doc folder. So far it is really fast. Tests at at least 350 Mbps for disk read and write. Everything works better including having multiple users open. All the old slowdowns are gone. Time will tell if they come back but for now it seems like a great upgrade and way easier than completely dismantling the mini to replace the drive.
customer_reviews.author: Guitar Dad

customer_reviews.title: Simple and convenient
customer_reviews.text: Leave it to Samsung to make something simple elegant, and very usable. The device is small and light. I did a benchmark test and got about 300 MBps (not the 450+ they were promising), but it's still faster than a conventional thumb drive. I love how the utilities to unlock the drive (for Windows and Mac) are on a read-only partition that's available as soon as you plug the drive in. That will keep people from needing to copy the utilities off to reinstall on another machine. Good thinking!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best storage product I've bought in a long time
customer_reviews.text: "Too long; didn't read" version: "Fast. Cheap. Works." Fast: Faster than any other storage I've personally owned. Zippy enough for things like watching high-res movies, at the very least, and I have no more difficult use case for now. Cheap: I paid approx one hundred smackers; one day, that will seem a lot for 250GB of flash, but I cannot complain about it right now. Works: I plug it into my computer (running Elementary Linux); it shows up as a storage device. Voila. If it fails unexpectedly anytime soon, I'll change my opinion ;)
customer_reviews.author: timothylord

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly as an external boot drive in osx 10.11.6
customer_reviews.text: Just wanted to do a final update. Still running as a main hard drive for my iMac since I bought it. Now in 2020 this drive is still working perfect. No issues at all even with OS updates/upgrades. My Mac stays on and in sleep until I use it. Works great. Using as external boot drive on late 2015 imac. Using internal drive for time machine now. Have not had one issue yet. No problems during sleep or anything. The speed increase is awesome. Just booted into recovery and restored internal drive to external with disk utility and that was it.
customer_reviews.author: K. Sarson

customer_reviews.title: Amazing! VERY Noticeable speed difference from traditional USB 3.0 external hard drives
customer_reviews.text: Amazing. I'd previously only owned traditional USB 3.0 hard drives - which were fast - but not fast enough to edit video in Final Cut Pro - especially when adding a few effects, transitions and color corrections. This SSD is super fast - and Final Cut Pro eats through video on this drive with no issue. It's as if you're working locally on your own SSD. Must buy if you're a content creator - or if you're looking for super (super) fast transfer speeds!
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas A.

customer_reviews.title: Small and very portable, Fast transfer speed and great quality material.
customer_reviews.text: Small and very portable and it is very fast, if using USB C to USB C it will reach the speeds promised, but let's say you use USB C to USB A 3.0, then your speed will be a bit slower. I use it to Image computers, computers with SSD's take about 4 minutes, computers with regular spinning Hard Drives take about 10 minutes. Overall it's a great product, I would recommend to IT professionals, Computer Enthusiasts, however, if you are looking to use it to just store your Data, in your position I would instead purchase a regular spinning disk external hard drive or a USB 3.0 flash drive 32 -128 GB because they are cheaper.
customer_reviews.author: Edward manakhimov

customer_reviews.title: Smooth as silk!!!
customer_reviews.text: I have a SSD inside of my Retna 🖥. It's only 256GB. I couldn't afford the price Apple wanted for the 1 terabyte SSD. So I researched external SSD's. Samsung had the best reviews and the most reasonable prices. Well, I really didn't know how much noise my external HDD made until I switched over to the Samsung SSD. In noise alone it was worth the price. The performance is as stated. The transfer speeds are blazing. I will not get technical. Other reviewers have done a great job with that. Long story short, buy it!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Chris Franklin

customer_reviews.title: This vs Internal with an Enclosure
customer_reviews.text: Ok, So I was debating between this or an actual SSD and buy an enclosure with so I can save like 20$ and get a faster results, let me tell you I have the Samsung PCI 950 Pro for my PC, and I swear this little external SSD doesn't feel any different from the 950 Pro plus you get the benefit of the portability, and its sooo small, any smaller and you can fit it in your wallet "I wish tho" go for it its fast, small, portable, and efficient
customer_reviews.author: Faris Iskandrani

customer_reviews.title: Tiny but quick external bootable SSD for mac
customer_reviews.text: I use this Samsung T3 portable SSD-1TB as an external bootable drive for iMac5k (late 2015) and mac book pro (retina, late 2013) OS X 10.11 and highly recommend it. I formatted it as OS X Extended (Journaled), encrypted with filevault2 and use Carbon Copy Cloner to clone my imac5k internal SSD into a bootable external SSD. Booting my imac5k from this external SSD takes about 55 sec = only 10 sec. longer than booting from the internal SSD! I can also boot my mbp from this external SSD and have all my imac5k data available while on the road.
customer_reviews.author: andy3131

customer_reviews.title: Very light weight with a great writing speed
customer_reviews.text: It's very light you can carry it easily in your pocket and also fast. I did test the writing speed from my old laptop "4 years old" to this Portable SSD the writing speed in average was about 80/Mbps which is about four times the speed of my WD HDD. Taking into the account that my laptop is old and i got USB 3.0 port not 3.1 "which is usually 3 times faster and this SSD is compatible with it" so it works for me and yes this is a good deal. Trust me it would save lot of time specially for those who backup regularly.
customer_reviews.author: Khaled

customer_reviews.title: Super fast external drive for Windows 10 and macOS Seirra
customer_reviews.text: This is my fastest external drive so far (See below for the speed using(Picture 1&2) and using the normal usb c - usb 3.1 cables (Picture 3 & 4) bot in WIndows 10 bootcamp for Macbook Pro 13" (Late 2016 Edition).
customer_reviews.author: alver

customer_reviews.title: Couldn't ask for a better external laptop drive
customer_reviews.text: I bought the 500GB version of this to be used as a TimeMachine backup drive for a MacBook Pro. First one died within two weeks. Wouldn't mount. Amazon quickly replaced it, and the replacement has been performing flawlessly. These drives are extremely small; thinner and shorter than a deck of cards. They're also silent (of course; no spinning parts), very fast, and very portable. Couldn't ask for a better external laptop drive, really. Sure, it costs more than a small portable spinny drive, but those have fairly bad failure rates in my experience, and are noisier and slower. If you can afford it, it's worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Rehrauer

customer_reviews.title: Does exactly what it says it will do, provide a nice alternative to cloud storage.  It's convenient [shirt pocket] and secure.
customer_reviews.text: This device works great for me. It is big enough in terms of storage and fits easily into a shirt pocket for mobility. The software didn't require any genius set up and has been reliable. I supplement my storage with this device, primarily using a Drobo however if one has storage needs that fit the capacity this device would manage the entire library quite well. It's very handy for moving files around as I travel. There are other solutions but I am not a fan of cloud based storage for privacy reasons. This device allows me to manage my files quickly and securely. Great for banking and other private records. It performs quite well for me.
customer_reviews.author: DelCha

customer_reviews.title: Read and write speeds are very very slow. Over ...
customer_reviews.text: Read and write speeds are very very slow. Over 30 minutes to transfer iTunes backup from MacBook Pro to T3. Read and Write speeds are really off. I did run the Apple app inside the T3 also so that is not the issue. Samsung if you are reading this I want a new one that works properly and Not a slow snail. I attached video here and uploaded one on YouTube for people to see. Look at how long it takes to transfer 1GB!!
customer_reviews.author: Donna

customer_reviews.title: Samsung tablet A, SLR and this storage unit
customer_reviews.text: Bought this unit for storing my photos during my vacation of two months of traveling. I used my Samsung tablet A as my interface between my slr and this storage unit. Not everything was smooth during the transfer, occasionally the transfer would fail; I'm assuming that these problems were software issues on the part of the tablet. I would sometimes have to start over by rebooting the tablet to attempt the transfer again. Also, for some reason, the transfer of photos between my tablet and the storage unit would corrupt one or two of the last photos, so they would be lost.
customer_reviews.author: ugimp

customer_reviews.title: Fast external drive
customer_reviews.text: Extremely fast external drive. Use on 2016 Macbook pro for video editing. Would buy again
customer_reviews.author: No Name

customer_reviews.title: excellent quality external drives
customer_reviews.text: I really love these tiny durable performant drives. For people who dislike the cloud for privacy, performance, or intermittency reasons, and who travel between multiple "homes": you can keep a desktop with USB3 at each, and install a bootable system on this drive. Then just carry this tiny drive when you travel and you can bring your entire environment without messing with the cloud or any syncing technologies.
customer_reviews.author: Herbert Longfellow

customer_reviews.title: Great Drive Great Speeds
customer_reviews.text: I can't say enough about how this drive is so sweet having 480 gigabytes of storage on an SSD small enough to fit into your wallet was unimaginable 10 years ago. The drive gets warm after continuous use but it just keeps delivering outstanding data transfer speeds Time After Time. I just wish I would have got that one terabyte version. Do not delay by this drive today. The only negative thing I can think about for this drive isn't them not including USB C to USB C cable but you can get one on Amazon for about 5 bucks.
customer_reviews.author: Smoothbassman

customer_reviews.title: Phenomenal Drive!
customer_reviews.text: With the proper cabling, you will NOT be disappointed (see pics). The Apple "Charge Cable" is NOT the choice for you (35/39MBs w/r). The cable that comes with the drive is fantastic as long as you have a USB-A port on your computer (393/423MBs w/r). Theseems to work great, nearly maxing out the drive speed according to specs (399/423MBs w/r).
customer_reviews.author: Wade Carpenter

customer_reviews.title: Died quickly
customer_reviews.text: Died almost as soon as I started using it. Didn't finish loading files when it crashed. Will not respond to any efforts to re-boot.
customer_reviews.author: SueB

customer_reviews.title: I put this on a base model 2014 Mac Mini ...
customer_reviews.text: I put this on a base model 2014 Mac Mini as the boot drive via USB 3 that has Mac Sierra OS . I had no problem getting it to work. I did not use the encryption software. I just used erase to partition it and then a cloning software. You must partition/erase it correctly so make sure you look at you tube or an article to configure it correctly. I will never by a base model Mac nor PC again. This external SSD now made my computer usable and office programs open so much faster.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It was plug-n-play with my PC and am very happy with the purchase (I got it for $169 on ...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this because I was tired of waiting for game data to load from my PC's hard drive. I didn't care about fast booting my computer but when loading games and the constant reading of data from disc as you play most games, I was getting tired of the pauses. So an external drive was my choice. This device can take full advantage of the USB 3 interface bandwidth. Heck it is even ready for a USB-C interface which could be even faster for some. It was plug-n-play with my PC and am very happy with the purchase (I got it for $169 on sale here).
customer_reviews.author: Cheezenub

customer_reviews.title: Best $200 I ever spent.
customer_reviews.text: I have had this drive for a few months, and so far, it seems like the best $200 I ever spent. Lighting fast speed combined with slim durability wrapped in a great-feeling enclosure, if you want a place to put your data and you want an SSD that is compact, reliable, durable, and every other positive word to describe a device like this, it's perfect for you. Not to mention, it uses USB C.
customer_reviews.author: Harrison Gordon

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size but extremely slow
customer_reviews.text: I was very excited to get a very tiny SSD which seemed powerful and next to stellar reviews but when I tried to backup about 12GB of data no matter what I did or which laptop PC or MAC it was extremely slow and would take about 15-20 minutes to do so. When I tried with a regular HD it would copy that same exact data in 5-10 minutes. Maybe the one I have is a broken one but none the less I had to return it due to it being so slow to do a simple read/write.
customer_reviews.author: Summer

customer_reviews.title: A Real Winner
customer_reviews.text: Super fast, super compact... just super. I loved the first one so much I bought two more of the 1TB drives and one of the 2TB drives. I can now store everything I need and carry it with me wherever I go and never have to regret leaving a file at home. I used a number of the online cloud-based file storage services but maxed those out, so I needed something else. I found exactly what I needed with these drives.
customer_reviews.author: FlyBoy

customer_reviews.title: Compact, Very Fast, Obviously Silent, and Great Build. Get One!
customer_reviews.text: I haven't had this drive long enough to really say it'll last a long time, but so far, this thing is exceptional. I love it. I'm gonna order a few more, as I do a lot of photography and music production. It's super-fast, very compact and feels sturdy. I did buy a nice little case for it and a smaller USB Type-C cable. Great little drive!
customer_reviews.author: M. Turner

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy Samsung Portable SSD. Doesn't work with macOS Catalina
customer_reviews.text: The device worked just fine before Catalina. However its software doesn't support Catalina. Even the latest update of its SSD Apps version 1.6.6 doesn't help. There is absolutely no support to fix this urgent problem. Samsung should have known long before Catalina official launch that its software won't work and should have fixed it. Next time there is any major OS update, I don't think I can guarantee that Samsung device will continue to work.
customer_reviews.author: Saravoot

customer_reviews.title: Compact, USB-C, Looks fast so far
customer_reviews.text: I was surprised at how small this device is. I expected a 2.5 inch form-factor drive inside of a case and this thing is probably as wide but moderately shorter. I was also surprised that it came with a USB-C cable but I guess that's the way things are going. I'm using the disk to install Sierra on so that I can migrate and test from Yosemite. Reformatting was a piece of cake. I could see buying a few more of these for old Macs to use as boot drives.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great external 500GIG SSD Backup drive.
customer_reviews.text: Nice compact drive at a good price point for a 500GIG SSD. It's also made by Samsung - I've never had any problems with any Samsung SSDs in the past 3 years. Comes with a 3 foot USB 3 cable. Makes data transfer 4X as fast as with my old 1TB HD which only used a 2.0 USB cable. The SSD doesn't need a power supply, as did the 1TB drive (which failed.) The drive is small too, roughly 2X3X5/8" thick. You won't be disappointed with this drive. It's a winner. Price point is good too.
customer_reviews.author: PK1950

customer_reviews.title: Couldn't Be Happier
customer_reviews.text: Love it! Nice compact size, light weight, and good USB cable length. Super easy to install, just hook up the USB cable. Has login security available if you want it. But most of all - it's super FAST! And I'm using a USB 3.0 port not 3.1 I transferred 28.4 GB of images from an SSD hard drive in 1 min 35 sec. That's 295 MB/s! Seems pretty good to me! So much better than a thumb drive and less expensive too. So far, I'm really happy with this purchase and highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: MSW

customer_reviews.title: Great Upgrade
customer_reviews.text: Love this drive! I had an older 1.5 GB old school drive that was the size of dinner plate and had moving parts, plus a cord to attached to the USB port AND a power cord. Needless to say this drive is it! It is small, saves fast and fits in the palm of my hand. Couldn't ask for more. Highly recommend a carrying case to protect it. Amazon has one that fits it perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Tranquility

customer_reviews.title: No more traditional external hard drives for me...
customer_reviews.text: The SSD is superfast and light. I run my email from an external drive (the folder is 71Gb) and I need to back it up in the multiple computers I use. (I cannot rely on the cloud because I also travel to developing countries where the internet connections, sometimes, are not very good.) Because of intense backup activity, the traditional hard drives typically do not last more then 18 months. This SSD is likely to last much longer, consumes less battery than the traditional hard drive, and is significantly faster. I am very happy.
customer_reviews.author: JHV

customer_reviews.title: Nice while it lasted.
customer_reviews.text: I love the small size and decent transfer speeds. Unfortunately, one of the contacts in the USB slot broke and now it doesn't work. I have plugged various USB devices in and out hundreds of times, this maybe 50 before it broke.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler

customer_reviews.title: Speedy!
customer_reviews.text: Needed a new external drive because my WD Passport Ultra USB 3.0 had totally failed. Rather than purchase another WD drive, even though it was more expensive, I decided to try this one. The difference in speed is phenomenal. I needed to do a complete backup of a laptop: when it worked, my WD drive took many hours. I just copied a 1.72GB folder to this SSD - it took 19 seconds - very cool !!
customer_reviews.author: Laurie

customer_reviews.title: excellent on fedora 24, with ext4
customer_reviews.text: very fast (make sure you plug it into a 3.0 port (blue)) . I used gparted to format it as an ext4 file system on Fedora Linux 24. Works great. Beautiful little gadget. I just copied to this drive a directory containing 145,000 files totaling 128 GB in 14 minutes and 46 seconds. Is it wrong to love a backup device?
customer_reviews.author: Michael Goulish

customer_reviews.title: working fine with my Nvidia Shield TV
customer_reviews.text: I bought this external SSD drive for my 16 GB Nvidia Shield TV as an expansion to handle more games and for better performance. it worked like a charm out of the box. only it takes some time in the beginning while being formatted by the Nvidia Shield.
customer_reviews.author: Ali ALJOHANI

customer_reviews.title: 3rd SSD Drive
customer_reviews.text: This is my 3rd SSD drive. The first two are in my computer and this one is for my pics. The read write is so much faster the a regular hard drive. When retrieving my pics for LR they load and save so much faster. If you are on the fence about getting a drive like this don't. They are so much faster and make the work flow so much better
customer_reviews.author: Proud Model Train N ScalerTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Great backup that's compatible with Macbooks
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to use in conjunction with my Macbook and it works like a charm-it's compact, portable, fast, and easy to use. Much better than the external drive I was using previously. I was worried it wouldn't work well with Mac products based on some of the reviews, but I haven't had an issue with it. It's not cheap, but for reliable storage, it's worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: J. Maclauchlan

customer_reviews.title: Great little big drive
customer_reviews.text: Super fast, high capacity, super small. Great backup and transfer drive. Got the 1TB. Created a 800Gb Mac partition and a 200GB Windows partition and it works like a charm. The former is my Time Machine backup drive and the later my Unreal Engine install drive (for Bootcamp Windows) on a MacBook Pro (Late 2015). I also use it to transfer videos from one machine to another (between Windows and Macs). Lightning fast!
customer_reviews.author: changeagent

customer_reviews.title: Excellent external drive!
customer_reviews.text: This Samsung T3 portable SSD drive is So Nice! We took it on a recent vacation for backing up photos. It was fast, reliable and durable. I also took a Toshiba external hard drive on this trip as a second backup, and the Samsung T3 outperformed it in every way! Transfers that would take six or eight minutes for the Toshiba were done in under a minute on the Samsung. Great drive!
customer_reviews.author: Scott Greaves

customer_reviews.title: Good price for a very fast external ssd.
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice external drive for my backups. It is very, very fast to write an image of my computer hard drive. It did take a bit of customer support, to get it to work with my box, though. I had to download a different driver package, but from then on was smooth sailing. That was a year ago, so maybe the issue is fixed by now.
customer_reviews.author: Freitag

customer_reviews.title: Super fast, tiny and lightweight.
customer_reviews.text: Just received this 2T Samsung T3 Portable SSD drive and love it. Very fast transfer speeds. Best of all the device is much smaller than I expected - only 3" x 2 1/4" - and weighs next to nothing. This is going to become my go-to travel drive. Can anyone recommend a good USB C to USB C cable that support the kind of speed this device requires? Device comes with a USB C to USB 2 cable, ugh.
customer_reviews.author: NewYorker

customer_reviews.title: A godsend for pros!
customer_reviews.text: Hands down the fastest drive I've ever used! I'm a photographer who works on tight deadlines and this has been one of the best investments I've ever made in speeding up my editing and upload process. I use a 2013 Retina MBP as my daily driver and haven't had any issues. I formatted the drive when I got it (like I do with any drive) and started using it without any problems. If you're on the fence just buy it!
customer_reviews.author: Mark J. O'Keefe

customer_reviews.title: Great for OTG on Android devices
customer_reviews.text: This is what you need to connect to an android device w/micro USB. ...For USB-C phones/tabs, all you need is a USB-C cable I only got 360 Read, 320 Writes on 2 different Macs (USB3). Minus 1 Star for not meeting spec Perfect of OTG - Works on my Note 5 and Samsung S2 Tab, [dunno, don't care about iOS.]
customer_reviews.author: Gadget FreakTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Fast, simple, small, cool.
customer_reviews.text: Really quick, really simple, no major installations or hassles, conveniently small, runs cool. What else do you want as an end-user? If you are familiar with technological aspect or have ways to measure speed, you may have broader understanding of this little gem and I am not sure which way it will take you. However, if you are someone who wants a simple and fast SSD, this is it. As always, this is a new product and it is too early to talk about reliability. For that, you need to wait for a year or so.
customer_reviews.author: Glupson

customer_reviews.title: Definlitely expensive, but definitley worth it.
customer_reviews.text: I use this for video editing as my external drive for active projects. As soon as projects become inactive I dump them onto a backup drive to save space on the SSD. I gotta say I'm in love with the speed and especially the small form factor as I'm always traveling and editing on the road. Editing moves noticeably faster with this. Definlitely expensive, but definitley worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher R Laxamana

customer_reviews.title: Xbox One compatible and SUPER fast.
customer_reviews.text: Used this for my Xbox One until I got the T5 and used this as a backup hard drive for my PC. This thing is blistering fast compared to the Gen 1 Xbox HDD and still far surpasses the Xbox One X's HDD. Highly recommend for smoother gameplay, substantially faster load times, and to make your Xbox sound quieter. Easy to format for your Xbox and back to PC if you ever want to.
customer_reviews.author: Jack

customer_reviews.title: Works good and previous comments about how hard it is to ...
customer_reviews.text: Works good and previous comments about how hard it is to set up are over rated You need the right canles and connectors on both ends or you wont get the soeeds promised And it doesnt have a battery so whatever device you hook it up to has to be strong enough to power it, more than the requirement for an sd card for sure Overall i got what i paid for, its well made, small, light, and fast
customer_reviews.author: peter meyers

customer_reviews.title: So good, I have 2 of them (250 and 500GB)
customer_reviews.text: For school projects where we are running multiple Virtual Machines from the device and it works like a charm. A fantastic product without a doubt. It has a Type-C interface (USB SATA III out), but it now the T5's are out, so prices are going to start dropping, but if you are looking for a Solid State storage device, you will not go wrong with this product. Approx. 3"x 2.25", small, powerful and fast!
customer_reviews.author: D. Martin

customer_reviews.title: Supports multiple running VM images without slowing down
customer_reviews.text: While still a bit pricey contrasted against spinning drives, this SSD and its fast USB3 interface allow me to store and run multiple virtual machines simultaneously. This supports my penetration testing workbench that is portable among host machines without compromising speed. If you are considering a laptop with an SSD drive, you might consider downsizing the internal laptop drive and augmenting with this unit for external storage, saving quite a few bucks.
customer_reviews.author: rxfelix

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my recording studio.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for my recording studio. Incredibly fast drive, reliable, and a small footprint. This is a considerable amount smaller than most external drives. USB 3.1 is fast enough for just about everything you can imagine. Technically not as fast as thunderbolt but most things don't process at 20-30 Gb/s anyways so it's inconsequential. Very pleased with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Shawnz

customer_reviews.title: and it's SUPER FAST when copying files for external storage
customer_reviews.text: This thing is incredible. 500 GB is plenty of storage space for my needs, and it's SUPER FAST when copying files for external storage. I have an SSD in my desktop, and its insane speed is what prompted me to go with this portable SSD. It's also very compact at 2.25" x 3" and it's also great that the cord that comes with it has a little velcro loop to keep it nice and tidy when storing it away. If you're looking for a small, clean-looking portable external hard drive with plenty of storage space and crazy speed, look no further.
customer_reviews.author: M.S.

customer_reviews.title: Solid but a little pricey.
customer_reviews.text: This hard drive is fast and works very well with the new MacBook Pro. I used a USB-C to USB-C cable I had from another product to connect which makes it easier to use. I wish Samsung would have included one in the box. Price was decent but still high compared to non SSD drives but this works great for what I use it for. I would imagine they will continue to drop as they become more common.
customer_reviews.author: Michael G. Nienaltowski

customer_reviews.title: An Excellent SSD External Drive ...
customer_reviews.text: This Samsung T3 Portable SSD Drive (1 TB) is a great drive. It has performed flawlessly since I received it. I would highly recommend it for anyone who has data that is critical to their daily living. While it is expensive, the cost is made up by the speed and security of the drive itself. I have it networked with 3 other USB hard drives, so it is backed up multiple time, as well as to the cloud (a best practice for data). The case is an essential part of the package for carrying the drive in a mobile setting.
customer_reviews.author: H. Court Young

customer_reviews.title: The Fastest, Hands Down!
customer_reviews.text: I own a PC service company and this drive (after 2 years) continues to be the fastest device we've ever connected to a USB port. Needless to say, this drive has been utilized on numerous PCs over a lengthy period of time. It has never hiccuped once. If you can foot the bill, this is the drive to purchase. You can't go wrong with Samsung!
customer_reviews.author: Jim Carter

customer_reviews.title: Great drive, once i figured-out why it would not run on my USB 3.0 extensions.
customer_reviews.text: Great drive, once i figured-out why it would not run on my USB 3.0 extensions. It is USB 3.1 and requires more power than most USB 3.0 outlets supply over cables longer than 3'. It took me a long time to figure this out; Now i have it running on 10' extensions. Copies 80gb file from internal SSD via 3.1 at ~400MB/s. Much faster than my HDD external 3.0 drive at ~80MB/s (if i remember correctly).
customer_reviews.author: CoconutGrover

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: fast delivery! product comes in just as described. I have owned it for a while now and it still works amazing. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: thang

customer_reviews.title: Tiny, fast drive
customer_reviews.text: Using this as my external clone drive for my NVMe backup. Acronis software sees it just fine, oddly Windows sees it in device manager but doesn't give me a directory. Maybe just a "thing" about my Win10. Anyway, reads and writes the backups just fine.
customer_reviews.author: video_man

customer_reviews.title: Great addition to my son's Xbox One system
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my son's Xbox (Xbox One) and it works great. Just plug it in, find it in settings, and start using it. Downloads and game load times are definitely faster, and this provided all the memory he needed to download a bunch of games.
customer_reviews.author: Albatross

customer_reviews.title: looks 100% portable and sturdy.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a boot drive for my Mac mini, which has a HDD. It is so small that would go unnoticed. Very fast. It changed my experience with my Mac mini - HDD is so slow, you can literally go run errands and when back the computer would be booting still. Definitely would use as my mains external storage, looks 100% portable and sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Vitor

customer_reviews.title: Nice upgrade!
customer_reviews.text: Super fast, super small, and good security. Glad I got this! I use it on my 2013 Macbook Pro for video editing in Premiere. I don't see any difference with speed between this drive and the internal drive.
customer_reviews.author: Case

customer_reviews.title: Small and light weight portable drive
customer_reviews.text: Small, light weight, beautifully design. 500GB is more than sufficient for my need as it used mostly to store my documents. I scanned everything and dumped them here, going paperless, well trying to anyway. Cost a little more than the traditional drive but having said drive corrupted is quite a pain so hoping this one being SSD will fare better. It has type C connector and C-to-USB cable. If you have a new lap top with C port will need to get a C-to-C cable
customer_reviews.author: Anna

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my needs
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for my needs. I wanted a safe yet portable media to carry my data with me. I did some research and this product consistently received high reviews. Based on those, I was willing to pay the high cost for this device. NOTE: Be sure to regularly back up this device. Although the encryption reasonably protects the data should the device gets lost or stolen, having a backup may be essential.
customer_reviews.author: Sue M.

customer_reviews.title: This is one very great piece of technology, particular for digital photography.
customer_reviews.text: I got the 2 tb after being so happy with owning the 500gb, but I couldn't fit all my pictures on it. I got the 2tb for lightroom having about 150k pictures ~1.2tb to manage. The speed is faster than my iMac internal drive and 5-10x faster than the regular hard drive I was using. Plus it's small and quiet. I paid quite a bit for it but I work faster and I can now fit all my pictures on one small fast drive and take it on the go.
customer_reviews.author: Duff

customer_reviews.title: Fast, light, great price
customer_reviews.text: Incredibly quick, I bought it to supplement as well as backup my 15" Macbook Pro that has 256GB of SSD storage. I've moved majority of my less commonly accessed files for graphic design onto it, and simply plug it in when I'm working on projects that require them. I notice zero difference between it and the internal storage.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: So light and small it feels like it's probably not even real. But, fortunately, it seems to be. :)
customer_reviews.text: So light and small it feels like it's probably not even real. But, fortunately, it seems to be. :) Only complaint is it's cable USB A top USB C. I'm using it USB C to USB -C, but I realize I may be in the minority for that right now. All in all, super happy. Very small and compact. No fear putting it in a backpack like I did with my spinning disk drives. Super fast. Great stuff.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy Vaught

customer_reviews.title: Small, Fast, Simple
customer_reviews.text: Does what it's supposed to. It stores a lot of files, and transfers them very, very quickly. I have had no issues and appreciate that it has no moving parts or floating heads like a hard drive... much more durable. And it's compact. I'm a photographer and I need to know when I travel that all my images are always backed up and I won't lose anything, no matter what.
customer_reviews.author: Eric L.

customer_reviews.title: The best external drive, hands down
customer_reviews.text: The best external drive, hands down. For mac or PC laptops/desktops. When it's plugged for the first time in any computer, you have to set it up (there are many users revies that explain how), but it's very easy. Very small, light, great!!!
customer_reviews.author: chismg

customer_reviews.title: LOVE this
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE this drive. I bought the 2 TB T3 to add to my older version T1. It is so SMALL and so FAST. Really good for video editing on my MacBook Pro. I'm buying an additional one today. The space these save in my travel bag in unreal. Fast speed is key for what I use it for, and I would forgo the space saving for a faster larger drive. But this is both tiny and super fast.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Speed and size is what I expected. Back up and longer term personal storage device it does the trick.
customer_reviews.text: The size is great and so far the speed to SSD and back has been as fast as RAM. Primary use is for storage of my personal and work data I would be reluctant to place on Google Drive. And Google Drive back up, which according to Goog is not needed but hey, I don't fully trust even the ones j love with my stuffs. Sorry Goog, still love ya.
customer_reviews.author: dbknittel84

customer_reviews.title: Super upgrade for an older iMac
customer_reviews.text: For all you Mac owners that have the spinner HD. I formatted this drive and cloned my old iMac HD to it no problems, boots sooo much faster it's like a "new" 2013 Mac.. I was getting sick of how slow startup and programs were and was ready to buy a new one but now I will hold off doing that. Now the only other reason would be the upgrade to the Retina but my eyes aren't that good to see the big difference.
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: Great portable drive and a good solution to carrying multiple ...
customer_reviews.text: Its Small. Its Fast. It doesnt require external power. The only device that hasnt recognized it is my Android TV box. Otherwise from all my various PC's and Macbook's the drive has successfully mounted, read, and wrote data with no issues. Great portable drive and a good solution to carrying multiple mini usb drives.
customer_reviews.author: PiyoPiyo

customer_reviews.title: Great for Windows on an external drive.
customer_reviews.text: I run Windows 10 on my Mac off this external drive. It games wonderfully, without taking space on my internal Mac SSD. The speed makes any potential bottleneck almost unnoticable. Any issues I experience, I'm comfortable beginning the troubleshoot elsewhere instead of blaming this drive.
customer_reviews.author: CalvinHobbesN7

customer_reviews.title: Fast, fast, fast.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as an external boot drive for my (non-upgradable) iMac. Worked perfectly! Plugged it in, formatted it and loaded the OS and enjoyed super fast boot times plus near instantaneous app launch. I use a maxed out iMac at work for Photoshop but with this SSD my iMac makes Photoshop perfectly usable with only 8GB of RAM. Super happy as my home machine is no longer my penalty box.
customer_reviews.author: photomonkey

customer_reviews.title: Great Small Portable SSD
customer_reviews.text: Great small fast Drive..can't go wrong with this drive. Plenty fast and stable as a backup for me. I tried using a SSD to USB External Drive Case, (Inateck) using a Samsung SSD..but that just didn't give me speed that this T3 does. I bit the bullet and went for this device...have not looked back since.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Small, Speedy, Super reliable!
customer_reviews.text: Can't believe how small this is. Super fast, and so far (~1 year) super reliable. I use this with my MacBook Pro to store my massive photo library and even though this is an external drive, there seems to be virtually no lag when browsing/accessIng photos. Can't wait for lower prices and higher capacities (eventually of course)! Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: BeeWee

customer_reviews.title: Awesome portable SSD
customer_reviews.text: The T3 is an awesome portable drive that doesn't take much room in my laptop bag and has worked perfectly whenever I needed it.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: You can't beat Samsung for fast and reliable portable data
customer_reviews.text: You know the brand name. Their SSDs, along with Intel's, are the only ones I'll buy. This particular model, the T3, is just really, really convenient for those who need portability. I use it to move data between my Windows and Mac devices (yay exFAT file). I also use it on my Nvidia Shield as a media drive. No more messing around with putting 2.5" SSDs in clunky cases.
customer_reviews.author: ichicolco

customer_reviews.title: Amazing hard drive for a photographer on the go
customer_reviews.text: I needed a small and light weight ssd hard drive for my photo biz. I needed one that you can put in the pocket or bag and go. It is by far my fav hard drive now. Its soooo small and light. It was so light that I didnt even think that there was a hard drive in it. I plugged it in and man o man is this thing fast. It is not my perfect photographers right hand man. if you need a hard drive please just get it already!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Falsely advertised capacity!!!
customer_reviews.text: Although I purchased the 2TB model, The drive only displays 250gb available even though it says "2TB" on the actual drive. I am running Mac OS X El Capitan 10.11.6 and have installed all available Samsung software and drivers. I have also tried formatting the disk with every option available under the disk utility app. There is no documentation online for a fix for this. For an $800.00 hard drive that only has 1/8th of it's advertised capacity, this has turned out to be an ENORMOUS waste of money. I hope that Samsung can offer a fix for this.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fast, small and reliable...
customer_reviews.text: Fast, small and reliable... I use this for audio, video and photo. I also use it for data transfer. This drive travels with me weekly. Bounced around in a bag - I did buy the case which was a definite good purchase. I waited a while to join the SSD train and I can now say well worth it!
customer_reviews.author: T

customer_reviews.title: Great replacement for older imacs where you don't want to take them apart to install a SSD
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to use as the boot disk for my 2010 27" imac and haven't been sorry. It works flawlessly and the computer is significantly faster. I'm sure it would be even faster if it didn't have to read and write through the USB 2.0 connection but I didn't want to risk taking the computer apart to change the internal drive.
customer_reviews.author: Desert Rat

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: Nice form factor (very small and light!) with impressive transfer speed. Biggest problems: 1. Encryption password is limited to around 16 characters. What kind of terrible security is that?! 2. If you encrypt the drive, you can't use it on Linux-based systems. That includes external media servers or NAS such as Synology DiskStation. For this price, these are absolute disappointments.
customer_reviews.author: Hans

customer_reviews.title: Superb Quality at a Great Price.
customer_reviews.text: I can't think of anything negative to say about this ssd. It is extremely fast putting even the faster usb thumb drives in the rear window. I use this to keep my laptop in sync with my PC. Easy to set up and use...just plug in the usb c end into the drive and the usb a end into any usb port. Great buy especially for the money.
customer_reviews.author: amazonbuyer

customer_reviews.title: This drive is awesome.
customer_reviews.text: this mofo is fast and compact. I should've gotten the 2TB one but i'm not shelling out $7-800. This drive is fast and gets the job done. I't backed up about 450gb in about an hour for me (iMac). I have an external hard drive i bought last year and that took me 12 hours to back up about 300 gb. This drive is awesome.
customer_reviews.author: Will

customer_reviews.title: Works very well as fast exernal boot drive.
customer_reviews.text: Works great as external boot drive - I am booting Linux from it, at seemingly native speeds. The drive often feels faster than internal SATA SSD in the laptop - although that maybe because of Windows 10 bloat on the internal SSD.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: Beast mode is this thing's business.
customer_reviews.text: Beast mode is this thing's business. This HDD is blazing, especially on the new USB C standard. I can work with files on this drive and barely notice that it is a removable device. If you have a need for portable high speed storage.. this is it.
customer_reviews.author: John C.

customer_reviews.title: Blazing fast and easy to set up, works great with XB1
customer_reviews.text: Bought to use with my Xbox One, formatted in a snap and is amazingly fast! Provides an excellent advantage in games like Star Wars Battlefront where load times are key. In the Death Star expansion I am always the first to load in and in the 2nd phase of Battle Station (The Rescue) it allows me to get to R2-D2 and rescue before I encounter a single foe. I could not be happier with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Charlotte Sanders

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: Compact design. No set up issues. Just great for backing up your data. Our previous external hard drive was not solid state and the internal bearings wore out. Took hours for our tech to retrieve our information. Its worth paying a little extra for SSD to not have to worry about that
customer_reviews.author: Brenda A Connor

customer_reviews.title: Fast for video editing/DIT
customer_reviews.text: I use this for transferring files from camera sources to take to my computer for video editing. I have pulled files from ssd hard drives from a Blackmagic Production 4k Camera and an Odyssey Q (used to capture from a Sony FS700), as well as various dslrs. What would normally take hours took us less than 15min (about 300GB per shooting day). As long as you're running through usb 3.0, you'll love it
customer_reviews.author: BB

customer_reviews.title: Great LITTLE Device!
customer_reviews.text: Love this little thing. I have a couple of other 500gig SSD's but they are four times the size of this one. I lead photo trip to places like Tanzania, Peru, the Galapagos, etc. and size restriction in carry on make paring down essential. Before I leave for Tanzania I will own another one of these for back up.
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia J. Griggs

customer_reviews.title: Not reliable
customer_reviews.text: Bought this in May of 2016, only used it about 10 times to backup and copy about 20 GB for transfer to another computer, it failed about 95% of the way through the latest transfer and is now completely dead.
customer_reviews.author: droberts57

customer_reviews.title: Need USB-C to USB-C cable for late 2016 Macbook Pro
customer_reviews.text: Fast, small, Mac OS shows actually 500GB - included adaptor plus Apple's USB to USB-C adaptor doesn't register the device, so if you have a late 2016 Macbook Pro, you'll need a USB-C to USB-C cable.
customer_reviews.author: Customer 4583029

customer_reviews.title: This works great. It is compact
customer_reviews.text: This works great. It is compact, light weight, fast, reliable, and has no issues. It is a good idea to backup your photos, documents, etc., so why not get a great solid state drive to do the job. I've had this unit for quite a while, and it has never disappointed me. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: TR1970

customer_reviews.title: Perfect as External Photograph Storage/Editing for Lightroom on My MacBook Pro
customer_reviews.text: Exceeded my expectations. Size is impressive, speeds are accurate, doesn't overheat and works great with my Mac. I use it for my photography library in conjunction with Lightroom, I shoot in Raw and edit in Lightroom straight from this external SSD and cannot notice any speed differences compared to my internal SSD. Seems to be the best price on the market as well. Only think I'd change is smaller is obviously better and cord is longer than I need.
customer_reviews.author: MAC84

customer_reviews.title: Very compact and snappy.
customer_reviews.text: Very compact and snappy. I was using one of those extra long USB SSD thumb drives before, which always stuck out too far from the USB port. I would have rated this 5 stars if it had came with a simple carrying case and an additional USB-C to USB-C cable.
customer_reviews.author: bungee

customer_reviews.title: awesome and fast
customer_reviews.text: Awesome product. Super fast. I've had the 1TB version for quite a while now and still hasn't gone out on me, and I use it A LOT since I'm a video editor / director. Can transfer 100+ GB of stuff in like 20 minutes, maybe 30. That's AWESOME.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin C.

customer_reviews.title: Great Fast Portable Storage Drive
customer_reviews.text: This is a great fast storage device which is very portable. I use it to store my thousands of digital photographs and the upload and download times are amazingly fast when compared to my other external storage devices. The only thing missing is some kind of carrying pouch. I intend to purchase more of these devices, I highly recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: Flockton

product_meta.title: Samsung T3 Portable SSD - 250GB - USB 3.1 External SSD (MU-PT250B/AM)
product_meta.description: Portability is the key element shared among all digital devices today where everything, including you, is constantly moving. When you are always on-the-go, your data should be, too. Born and bred with potent portability in its core, the Samsung Portable SSD T3 is built strong and light and is equipped with a built-in security feature. Most of all, it offers the blazing-fast data transfer speed of up to 450 MB/s. With compatibility across multiple operating systems and devices, the T3 will take your data to another level of accessibility.
feature_bullets: Portable Design with Internal SSD-level Performance
Superfast Read-Write Speeds of up to 450 MB/s
Compatible with PC, Mac, & Android OS

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars309 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
